source_sentence: 【疏】義即不定者意說自證分若已轉依不唯緣見分亦了聲等故云不定如依眼根發識聞聲豈了日色境云一根發識緣一切境故言且據少分者且據因位說。

source_sentence: 【疏】次引彼六識之經證成者即指論中云彼經且說不共所依等是也。

source_sentence: 【疏】十八界為緣不同者即十八界為所緣境出能緣識多少不同。

source_sentence: 【疏】五三六有二至自在等分別者意說准因果十八界為所緣不同有多少故因見各隨應者因即因位也見者見分也各隨應者顯各緣自境故云隨應五三六有二者五即五塵三者三識緣謂五一一皆三識緣謂五識第六第八識且緣色立為眼識同時意識及第八識乃至領觸立為身識同時第六及第八識也第七緣內故此不說六有二者六者即六根二者即二識謂第六七識第六通緣六根第七唯緣第八第八即意根中收故通說六根二識緣也六一一不定者六者六識也一者即第六一今見分通緣六識一不定者即一法處法處是第六所緣如法處通果實色亦是五八識所緣五識由第六識引故得緣於法處實色本識亦變此實色若餘心所等第六緣無為六七二識緣滅道六七二智生故證真如故法處一今不定自在等分別者即約果位辨也果位五識皆得互緣不同因位如樞要說又云六一一不定者而佛果位六識緣境即不定一一通緣一切境也如此遍知者望極自在位分別。
translation: [Commentary] Five, three, six, there are two to self-contained and so forth discriminations This means that the causes and effects of the eighteen elements are different in terms of how many there are, so the cause and view are each concomitant with the cause, which is the causal stage.

source_sentence: 【疏】所依之頌如前已說者如第四句句五四六有二七八一俱依及開導因緣一一皆二等是問何有此文來答謂前說所緣頌故次有所依頌文來也指同前說。
translation: [Commentary] The verse that's relied upon is as explained previously, such as the fourth sentence, which states that the five, four, six, two, seven, eight, and one all depend on and lead to causes and conditions, each of which is two and so forth.

source_sentence: 【疏】准前文中至共依等故者有云准前辨六識依不共根得名具五義等也言不共者即簡因緣無間緣染淨依同境依同境者即第六識與五識為同境根故亦簡也共依等者若即本八識為根本故亦簡也等者等取以上同境等也。
translation: [Commentary] Referring to the previous passage, those who say the six consciousnesses are named based on the aspect of common dependency have five meanings and so forth, and those who say the aspect of common dependency is simple, that is, causal, uninterrupted, defiled, pure, and the aspect of the same object dependency.

source_sentence: 【疏】若由他力至法者意云此釋次上境頌中不定言也。
translation: [Commentary] If other powers reach the Dharma, this means that it's an indeterminate statement in the verse explaining the next higher object.

source_sentence: 【疏】顯此聚亦爾者且問初能變也將彼顯此上得心所後說性問此中心所法有不通三性何得同彼言影顯也答但約此聚起時同性非定令皆通三性又解此相應法性不定同故於心後明性彼王所總唯一性於所後明也。
translation: [Commentary] This is also the case when he asks whether the first [consciousness] that's capable of transformation will be the same as the first, or whether the second will be the same as the third, or whether the second will be the same as the third.

source_sentence: 【疏】又彼諸法不定通三性此定通者使後學者知此差別故前後辨性不定不得定同也。
translation: [Commentary] Also, those things that are indeterminate share the three natures, and those that are determined to share enable later learners to know the difference, so the indeterminate nature of the former and latter discernment can't be determined to be the same.

source_sentence: 【疏】名字隱故先解者意云以無記名字隱故先解也。
translation: [Commentary] Understanding comes first because the names are concealed means understanding comes first because the names of the indeterminate are concealed.

source_sentence: 【疏】無漏有為無為亦爾者意說此二能為此世他世順益故名為善有得有證者無漏有得無為有證。
translation: [Commentary] Uncontaminated existent and uncontaminated also means that these two things are called good because they're beneficial in this and other worlds.

source_sentence: 【疏】及由涅槃獲菩提二世益者即現安樂後不生惡趣也有云如無學證有餘依涅槃此世益死入無餘後世益。

It's also said that if someone has not studied and realized anything beyond this world, then they'll benefit from nirvāṇa in this world and enter the afterlife without remainder.

source_sentence: 【疏】今解至但是無記苦果者意說惡趣苦果但是無記非是不善於後世中非遠損故非不善雖令身苦來世非不善也。
translation: [Commentary] Now, this explanation up to the point of indeterminate painful retribution means that the painful retribution of negative rebirths is only indeterminate and not unwholesome.

source_sentence: 【疏】大乘亦得三性各有四種者善亦爾無記亦有四種無記如前第三卷第八識無記中廣分別。
translation: [Commentary] The Mahāyāna also has four kinds of each of the three natures.

source_sentence: 【疏】諸論總收至故別建立者意云諸論所說三性皆是此中四種三性收故云總收亦有此義非但是說此論中三性通說諸論中所有三性亦得故云亦有此義也於理不違故別建立者此論與諸論所有三性通理即不違故此論別建立四種三性無記等如第三卷說也。
translation: It's not just that the three natures in this treatise are explained in general terms, but that all three natures in the treatises are also obtained, so it's also said that they have this meaning. It's not contradictory to the principle, so it's established separately.

source_sentence: 【疏】唯十法俱故者不定地除輕安故云十法此云十一者總舉一聚為論非皆俱也。
translation: [Commentary] It's only because they're all part of the ten dharmas that they're not indeterminate, except for minor security, which is why they're called the ten dharmas.

source_sentence: 【疏】謂嗔至成十者即忿等小七中二並嗔總成十也除諂誑憍三者以通無記故。
translation: That is, anger up to the point where it becomes ten, which is anger and the other two of the lesser seven, and anger in general becomes ten, except for flattery, deceit, and pride, which is because it's shared with indeterminacy.

source_sentence: 【疏】通前二故者意云通一前善不善一及無記並如雜集論廣說有云無記非是前善復非不善故云通前二也。
translation: That's because it's shared with the prior two, meaning it's shared with the former good, unwholesome, and indeterminate, as explained in the extensive commentary on the Zaji lun, and it's said that indeterminate isn't prior good and isn't subsequent unwholesome, so it's shared with the prior two.

source_sentence: 【疏】又此二三四門至已略辨訖如善有二謂生得加行不善有二謂自相不善相應不善無記亦二謂有覆無記無覆無記等也如前廣明。
translation: [Commentary] Also, these two, three, and four aspects up to this point have been briefly discussed, such as there are two kinds of good, which are produced by applied practices, and two kinds of unwholesome, which are self-natured, unwholesome, and associated with unwholesomeness.

source_sentence: 【疏】若有為有種子至彼性中攝者意云有意三性若有種子皆隨現行是彼性攝。
translation: [Commentary] If there are seeds that exist up to the point where they're included in their nature, this means that there are three intentional natures, and if there are seeds that follow present actions, they're included in their nature.

source_sentence: 【疏】然此二三四門至各據一義者意云此論中有二三四門辨三性能對法論中辨三性總有二種先總後別先總者且以有為無為等故耶辨三性第二別辨三性別辨者如善以十三門分別不善有十二門無記有十四門此即別辨也此論與對法所說不同應撿對辨言有別者各據一義亦不相違也。
translation: [Commentary] But these two, three, and four approaches to discerning the three natures each according to a single meaning means that there are two, three, and four approaches in this treatise that discern the three natures in contrast to the Dharma treatise, which states that there are two kinds of general discernment, first general, and then specific.

source_sentence: 【疏】五識不能轉心發業者意云轉者起也五識不能起心發身語二業縱得名業者但名假業不名實業義由第六別方能起心發業故名隨轉心發業隨第六識後起故有云轉心發業者即第六意識造善不善業轉第八心令往諸趣生也如此功能五識所無但隨第六轉心發身語二業又五識不能發威儀但能緣威儀問如何五識得緣威儀鼻舌二識不緣威儀故答不爾今言緣者謂緣威儀路路者處也處即是五塵五識既為緣五塵所以愛五識緣威儀也意說五識緣威儀時即無記心攝也問云何威儀通五塵不答有是正工巧威儀有是相從得稱思如色聲身語表是正工巧香味觸是工巧業所依處總言工巧通五塵故五識緣也身表色是正威儀香味觸是威儀業所依引路總言威儀通四塵故四識緣然聲無行住坐臥攝故聲非威儀此二無記心若數習者皆得現前又准婆沙正理皆言何名工巧及威儀路方是色蘊也。
translation: [Commentary] The five consciousnesses can't change their minds to initiate karma; it means that the five consciousnesses can't change their minds to initiate two karmic activities of body and speech, even though they can be called karma, they're called provisional karma, not conditioned karma.

source_sentence: 【疏】除變化者謂天眼耳通亦非變化心也故五識無變化無記心也。
translation: [Commentary] Except for change, this refers to the divine eye and ear faculty, which are not changeable mental states. Therefore, the five consciousnesses don't have changeable indeterminate mental states.

source_sentence: 【疏】又非五識至相隨俱生者意說五識唯一剎那不得二剎那俱生亦無展轉無間更互而生者意說不先起眼識後起耳識後起鼻識等不得如是無間而生也故瑜伽云一念五識生已從此無間必意識生問五識生已意識生者豈五識同生答不爾言一念五識生者意說五識中隨類一識生已即意識生不妄須五識一時生也故言雖總意及別也是故五識三性不俱。
translation: [Commentary] Also, it's not that the five consciousnesses arise together with each other, which means that the five consciousnesses are only momentary and can't arise in two moments simultaneously, and there's no transition or interruption and mutual arising, which means that the eye consciousness that arises first, the ear consciousness that arises later, and the nose consciousness that arises later can't arise without interruption like this.

source_sentence: 【疏】定中聞聲非我所許者此師不許定中聞聲又三性俱起設縱許等者此師云縱許三性俱起唯定中可然散即不爾。
translation: [Commentary] Hearing sound in concentration isn't something I allow. This teacher doesn't allow hearing sound in concentration, and assuming the three natures arise together, this teacher says that even though the three natures arise together, it's only permissible in concentration, but distracting is not.

source_sentence: 【疏】方五俱生亦復同境者即由意識導引以後意方與五俱生及同境也。
translation: [Commentary] This refers to the fact that the five co-arising aspects are guided by consciousness, so the subsequent intention is to co-arise with the five co-arising aspects and the same objects.

source_sentence: 【疏】若雖導生五三性並者縱許五識三性並者應難云意識應三性並故量雖言如次所引者即次前文中引大論第三云五識善染必意導生者意證同性。
translation: [Commentary] Although it's said that the five samenesses of consciousness must be induced by the mind, even if the five samenesses of consciousness are permitted, it should be difficult to say that consciousness should be same-natured, even though it's quoted in the following paragraph from the third section of the great treatise as saying that the five consciousnesses that are well defiled must be induced by the mind.

source_sentence: 【疏】謂由了別定至意識故者意云有兩箇意識且如了別定之所緣境意識者唯緣定中一境心是又種種所緣境意識者即是意識於定中觀苦空無常等心是以境不一故名種種境意識也耳識生時由此二意識得生定中聞聲也雖演秘解別亦是撲揚法師一釋也。
translation: [Commentary] It means that from the concentration of cognition to consciousness, there are two consciousnesses, and just as the consciousnesses that are the objects of the concentration of cognition are only the mind that's the object of cognition, the consciousnesses that are the objects of cognition are the consciousnesses that are observing the mind of suffering, emptiness, impermanence, and so forth in concentration, which are called various objects of consciousness because the objects are not the same. When the auditory consciousness arises, these two consciousnesses can arise in concentration and hear sounds, even though the mystical interpretation is also the interpretation of the Dharma teacher Puyang.

source_sentence: 【疏】故定不俱者意顯三性定不俱不妨定中耳意二識俱同緣聲境也亦同是善性若爾言率爾隨身無記者據未自在位說。
translation: [Commentary] So concentration isn't shared, which means it shows that the three natures of concentration aren't shared, so it's possible that the two consciousnesses of ear and mind in concentration both have the same cognition of sound and object, and both are good in nature.

source_sentence: 【疏】亦非五識次第而生者意說五識中隨起一識即意識生更不容耳識隨眼後起故故由非次第而生餘識准知。
translation: [Commentary] Nor are the five consciousnesses produced in sequence because it means that one of the five consciousnesses that arises next is consciousness, and it's not permissible for the auditory consciousness to arise after the eye.

source_sentence: 【疏】上說五識唯一念解者上來解五識一念不通三性下依多念說亦不許五識三性並以能引意識一時不通三性故。
translation: [Commentary] The above explanation of the five consciousnesses being solely mindful refers to the above explanation of the five consciousnesses not being triune in one thought, and the following explanation based on multiple thoughts doesn't allow the five consciousnesses to be triune in nature and uses the consciousnesses that can be induced not to be triune in nature at one time.

source_sentence: 【疏】謂世俗至非生起剎那者此釋經中一心剎那也約此究意說也言一處為依止者即依止處所也又云相似相續至極相似故者釋一心中言由極相似故總名一心也。
translation: This is an explanation of the sutra's single-mindedness of moments that aren't arisen, and it's explained in terms of this investigative approach.

source_sentence: 【疏】明第八識至三性不俱者即第八識不得一時與五識中三性俱如論云三性俱者約第八七五中隨一善名三性俱也言自無記者即第八名曰淨無記。
translation: [Commentary] This explains the eighth consciousness up to the point where the three natures aren't shared, meaning the eighth consciousness can't be shared with the three natures of the five consciousnesses at one time as the treatise says, "The three natures are shared by the eighth, seven, and five consciousnesses according to the name of the good triad.

source_sentence: 【疏】此引五識相續文者至五識容俱者唯瑜伽論中明五識有二說一云五識唯一念三性俱二云五識許卒爾等流多念相續三性俱轉護法正宗依第二說此相續文前第四卷等無間依中俱引。
translation: [Commentary] This quotation from the text on the continuity of the five consciousnesses goes to the five consciousnesses that are inherently inherent, but there are two explanations of the five consciousnesses in the Yogâcārabhūmi-śāstra: one says the five consciousnesses are inherently inherent, the other says the five consciousnesses are inherently continuous, and the three natures are inherently inherent.

source_sentence: 【疏】雖亦緣色境者意識先與眼識同緣色境而聲境勝故與耳識同緣乃至起不善耳識。
translation: [Commentary] Although it also refers to the form object, the consciousness first refers to the form object with the eye consciousness, but the sound object is superior, so it refers to the same object as the ear consciousness and even gives rise to the unwholesome ear consciousness.

source_sentence: 【疏】或前一眼識至得三性並者意云雖卒爾等流多少不定然亦許三性俱時意說先時起眼識觀佛像未滅意後尋求尋求未決知是何像像復放光眼復重緣又起率爾謂前尋求未決定俱是率爾不至等流後時有色境至而其識生初起唯是卒爾復尋求及決定知聲境善不善等後相續心生即是等流所以卒爾多等流少容五識得俱行三性並也一念俱者如眼識觀像是善意與眼同緣又同即有香境並不善聲境至所以三性俱也香是無記故六識容許有三性俱非一切時皆必俱也言是卒爾多念者非約俱名多少據前後時節名多即前後起多率爾心故名多念。
translation: [Commentary] Perhaps when the preceding consciousness attains the triple combination, it means that although there's no certainty about how many times it will flow together, it's still possible for the triple combination to occur when it first arises, when the visual consciousness observes an image of the Buddha that's not yet extinguished, and then seeks to know what the image is, then emits light, and then the eye again re-conditions it, meaning that the preceding seeking hasn't yet determined that the triple combination will not reach the same level of flow, and then the colored object reaches it, and the initial arising of that consciousness is only a momentary moment of further seeking and determining to know that the sound object is good or unskillful, and so on.

source_sentence: 【疏】又解率爾等流至俱起故者意云如前第一約念明多少今時第二約識明多少如起率爾等流二心時或三四識起率爾一二識起等流或復飜此但於五識誰起率爾等流而有多少而亦不定其識之名目也隨於何境至其識即起亦不言先起此識後起彼識等也但隨境至即緣故故是置或字也。

source_sentence: 【疏】雖五一念三性得俱至此前師意者問若前師不許五識三性俱者瑜伽文如何會釋彼云五識三性俱有二說一云五識三性俱通多念相續前師不許三性俱此文如何通前師云五識雖一念三性得俱若眼識與意同緣善境時設有耳緣至亦不緣聲若緣聲者即須善眼識滅意與耳方同緣也善眼識不滅即意不緣聲此師會意也若護法意說一意識雖與五識同緣然性不必同也。
translation: [Commentary] Although the three natures of the five single thoughts can be shared by the former teacher, this question asks if the former teacher didn't allow the three natures of the five consciousnesses to be shared by the former teacher, how would the yoga text explain that there are two ways to say that the three natures of the five consciousnesses can be shared by multiple thoughts in continuity, and how would the former teacher not allow the three natures to be shared by this text?

source_sentence: 【疏】前所設難能引意識等者意云意雖與五識俱起而由前因不必同性故前所難云爾時意識應通三性難於此唐捐唐者虗也捐棄也前師道理徒領輪墨虗棄其功也言下引證者即答前問也意證耳意二識同緣性不必同意是善耳是無記故。
translation: [Commentary] The previously posed difficulty that leads to consciousness means that although mind arises together with the five consciousnesses and from the previous cause, it doesn't have to be the same, so the previously posed difficulty says that at that point, consciousness should share the three natures.

source_sentence: 【疏】如大目連至即便出定者證三性有別准其論文唯有二性如定中意識是善性定中率爾聞聲耳識是無記未自在位率爾隨心是無記故何得有不善性答意證性不同不必須具三性。
translation: [Commentary] Suppose Mahāmaudgalyāyana realizes that even when he leaves concentration, the three natures are distinct, and according to the text of his treatise, there are only two natures.

source_sentence: 【疏】或復起者即是耳識者意云與前別前約行人定中耳識與意識相應能取此聲今解意者定中聞聲耳識即起不言意識相應俱起意識定中得起耳識。
translation: [Commentary] Perhaps that which arises again is the auditory consciousness, meaning that it's different from the previous definition of a practitioner in which the auditory consciousness is associated with consciousness and is able to grasp this sound.

source_sentence: 【疏】顯揚論說種種意故者顯揚說有二意識一者唯了別定所緣意識唯是善性二者取種種所緣境意識即通三性故緣十八界故云非唯彼定相應意識能取此聲意顯彼論兼得耳識同聞也意證定中意識是善耳識率爾聞聲是無記故性不同。
translation: [Commentary] The Qingshan lun teaches that there are two kinds of consciousnesses: one is the consciousness that's the sole object of discriminating concentration, which is only good, and the other is the consciousness that takes on various objects as objects, which are shared by all three natures and therefore refer to the eighteen elements.

source_sentence: 【疏】定中耳識不領受故者若定中無耳識領聲者意識依何起希望而出定也問既許無色界心了一切者何妨定中意識領聲出定答言無色心了三界法者劣由加行方能了之此無加行故不能了也。
translation: [Commentary] The ear consciousness in concentration doesn't apprehend; therefore, if there's no ear consciousness in concentration that apprehends sound, what does the consciousness rely on to give rise to hope and escape from concentration?

source_sentence: 【疏】末後出定之意識者即在定最末後心也彼宗許此言欲聞聲故所以次念即出非己聞聲方出故故立量難如疏作量言應不即聞聲時出定者宗也然彼宗意云為欲聞聲所以欲出定故立宗違云汝為欲聞聲末後出定意識應不即為聞聲時出定因曰此位不聞聲故如前定中意也彼宗許定中末後意識未聞聲從此次念即出方聞聲也所以今立量故。
translation: [Commentary] The consciousness that comes out of concentration at the end is the mind at the very end of concentration. translation: [Commentary] But did the former teacher not understand this text? source_sentence: 【疏】有師引證者有異師引此文為證云等引位中無五識也故云彼雖非證然為會之。
translation: [Commentary] Some masters cite this text as proof that there are no five consciousnesses in the stage of equipoise, so it's said that although it's not proof, it's nevertheless an understanding.

source_sentence: 【疏】多識者如在定許起耳識不起餘四識故云等引位中無五識又云多人者即二乘等人定中不起五識據此道理故云三摩呬多位而無五識也非菩薩故者菩薩定中許起耳識等若八地已上雖常在定而用常寂靜不妨具起五識諸小菩薩則不爾也此即會前雜集論文。
translation: [Commentary] Many people, such as those in concentration, may give rise to the ear consciousness and not to the other four consciousnesses; therefore, it's called the absence of the five consciousnesses in the stage of equipoise.

source_sentence: 【疏】問如何定中至與耳識同緣者意問後師云若言定中意識與耳識因緣者如何意識俱受亦得與耳識因緣耶受應善性耳無記故問也。
translation: [Commentary] The question is, "How does the mental consciousness in concentration come to have the same causal connection as the auditory consciousness?" This is because the latter master asked, "If it's said that the mental consciousness in concentration has the same causal connection as the auditory consciousness, how can both consciousness and feeling also have the same causal connection as the auditory consciousness?

source_sentence: 【疏】散意入捨至耳心不生者此答上問即第一解此有二意初約入二約出且從散意入於至必是捨故以來約入解也捨者簡喜樂喜樂定中耳意二識不與捨受相應意說散位意識入捨定時必有捨受所引生率爾耳識而是無記與捨受俱有何所違言初起之時等者又解云約初出定說也且初出定意識猶尚昧劣與捨相應所引耳識當知亦爾疏云初起者起猶出也故捨受亦與二識同緣然不與喜樂等異受俱也明知返顯入根本喜樂定耳識必不生。
translation: This answer to the above question is the first explanation. There are two meanings here: first, it's about entering, second, it's about exiting, and from the point of entry of the mind in the mind in the mind in the mind in the mind in the ear, the two consciousnesses are not associated with the sensation of equanimity.

source_sentence: 【疏】二解至有不同故者意云此第二解雖定中意耳同緣何妨亦與異受相應如意識與喜等受相應不妨耳識初起與捨受相應故受不同亦如定中聞聲耳意二識雖因緣而性有別此亦可然。
translation: [Commentary] The second explanation is that although the mind and ear are in the same condition in concentration, why is it not also associated with different feelings? For example, if the mind consciousness is associated with feelings like joy, it might not be possible for the ear consciousness to initially arise in association with the sensation of equanimity, so the sensations are different.

source_sentence: 【疏】瑜伽論說至即是尋求心者意說第二解云雖復同緣不妨異受相應如是是中意耳二識復同緣故如此解者今引瑜伽文難云如瑜伽說五心中前三定是無記性如何說言定中尋求心是善耶若是善者違瑜伽文。
translation: [Commentary] The second explanation of what the Yogâcārabhūmi says about the mind that's seeking is that it might as well be associated with different feelings even though they're the same condition.

source_sentence: 【疏】又在定得起幾心等者意說定中得起初二心者明知二心是無記也瑜伽云五心前三是無記故知定中耳意二識不得言不同性合是同性俱無記故此總難也。
translation: Commentary: "Also, in concentration, how many minds can arise?" This means that those who say the first two minds can arise in concentration clearly know that those two minds are indeterminate.

source_sentence: 【疏】若散五心至亦通善等者即答前難意會瑜伽論文也瑜伽說五心中前三心是無記者約散心位故說多分言三心無記也若在定中除率爾心餘善者通善性。
translation: [Commentary] If the five scattered thoughts arrive, then they're also shared with the good, etc. This is the answer to the previous difficulty, which is to gather the text of the yoga treatise. The yoga says that the first three of the five thoughts are morally indeterminate, so it's said that many parts of the three thoughts are morally indeterminate.

source_sentence: 【疏】又五識必由尋伺所引者明知定中尋伺善心引生五識意證如此也若爾者未審初入定心是何地法應是初禪心不應是上地心以上地中無尋伺故既無尋思者五識應不生如何得知耶云五識必由尋伺引故此總難。
translation: [Commentary] Also, the five consciousnesses must be induced by discursive investigation. This is the realization that the five consciousnesses are induced by discursive goodness in concentration. If this is the case, then we haven't examined what stage of concentration the mind first enters, and it should be the first meditative state, not the upper stage, so there's no discursive investigation in the above stages.

source_sentence: 【疏】云此至解者意指於下文下文彼說尋伺中言五識必由尋伺引者顯多由彼起非說彼相應意說五識多由尋伺起非說一切位皆與尋伺相應也。
translation: [Commentary] This ultimate understanding refers to the following: when they say that the five consciousnesses must be induced by discursive investigation, it means that they are mostly produced by that, not that they are associated with that.

source_sentence: 【疏】又此定為唯有漏亦通無漏者此問三摩呬多定通有漏無漏耶答至二種俱得亦通凡聖如對法疏說即第引定也。
translation: [Commentary] And this concentration is only contaminated and also communicates with the uncontaminated? This question asks whether the samākhya concentration communicates with the contaminated and uncontaminated.

source_sentence: 【疏】又欲界至能引耶者問云如欲界耳識許無所有處異地心引生即如大目揵連於獼猴池側坐入無取有所定聞象王哮吼聲明知無所有處第六識引欲界耳識生也若爾者亦應二定以上起下三識時非要借下尋伺但用他地無尋伺意識引生耶以許異地心得相引故。
translation: [Commentary] Also, when the desire realm reaches the point of being able to induce, this question asks whether the ear consciousness in the desire realm is induced by the mind in another place, just as Mahāmaudgalyāyana sat beside a monkey pond and entered the concentration of nonacquisition and heard the roaring of the elephant king, knowing full well that the sixth consciousness in the other place induces the ear consciousness in the desire realm. If that's the case, should the lower three consciousnesses arise above the two concentrations?

source_sentence: 【疏】初起五識必尋伺引者此答意者率爾五識必藉尋伺引生此唯約率爾說等流即不許爾容非尋伺心所引故如在欲界豈一切五識等者舉例也。
translation: [Commentary] When the five consciousnesses first arise, they must be induced by discursive investigation. This answer means that the five consciousnesses at that rate must be induced by discursive investigation.

source_sentence: 【疏】又初起五識必尋伺引者意說即上二地意識俱初禪尋伺引下三識也。
translation: [Commentary] Also, the first arising of the five consciousnesses must be brought about by discursive thought, which means that the upper two levels of consciousness are accompanied by the first meditative discursive thought and the lower three consciousnesses.

source_sentence: 【疏】後位已去非尋伺心引者等流心已後或非尋伺引此即舉欲界耳識許異地心引生例二定已上借識亦有不心尋伺引問雖言容有不必尋伺亦容得上意識引下眼耳不答如說神通依餘近分等上既無眼耳故取眼耳俱時意識名眼耳通故云意識名通故四根本皆得引初禪眼耳通也。
translation: Although it's said that there's room for not having to search and pray, it's also possible for the higher consciousness to lead the lower eyes and ears without searching. translation: [Commentary] The three natures of consciousness that can be induced should be shared with those who ask whether the two natures of affliction and cognition are equally dependent on one type of affliction, unwholesome cognition, and indeterminate knowledge should be shared with the three natures of the sixth unified mind.

translation: [Commentary] If it also refers to the sense-fields, it means that it doesn't refer to the five consciousnesses together but refers to them separately from that, which is indeterminate.

source_sentence: 【疏】若與五識別緣唯緣法處既無此心者若唯緣法處可不同緣既無此唯緣法處心故知同緣既許同緣故知同現量引集量論證非直同現量即五俱意識亦無法執也。
translation: If there's no such mind that's only the locus of cognition, then he knows it's the same cognition because there's no mind that's only the locus of cognition.

source_sentence: 【疏】八地二乘至以此為證者意云三性容得俱時未必一切時皆得俱也以八地菩薩無不善五識故故知但是總從舉論也引喻證曰如第八與餘三性俱者且第八是根本率白淨無記意識是善若有不善聲境及無記香境至便有耳鼻等識生故三性俱但容俱未心皆爾又八地二乘位許三性俱者無漏心亦許引無記五識也。
translation: [Commentary] The eighth ground two-vehicle stage up to this point is the proof that when the three natures are allowed to be shared, they may not all be shared at all times. translation: One teacher permits the first ground to transform the five consciousnesses into the knowledge of what's created, and another teacher permits the Buddha stage to attain the latter teacher's correctness; therefore, the only basis for transforming the five consciousnesses is goodness.

translation: [Commentary] If that's not the case, it means that if we don't talk about the Buddha only as good, then the remaining stages will have five consciousnesses that are unwholesome and indeterminate, as in the commentary.

source_sentence: 【疏】初地以去至亦有無記五識者意云初地菩薩謂有修道不善貪嗔等既得與五識相應明知五識有不善也至四地雖伏我見善不善貪嗔等任運得起也又八地有無記五識者雖意識常在定恒善性若不與意識俱五識率爾便無記故曰或時亦有無記五識也。
translation: [Commentary] From the first ground and onward to also having the five indeterminate consciousnesses means that the bodhisattvas in the first ground say there's cultivation, unwholesomeness, greed, anger, and so forth, and since they've attained concomitance with the five consciousnesses, they clearly know that the five consciousnesses are unwholesome.

source_sentence: 【疏】三乘無學至何性六識俱起者佛唯善二乘無學通無記菩薩後得亦通無記不似同性。

translation: [Commentary] Among the five consciousnesses, until it's explained in sensation, this person means that the five consciousnesses are shared by covered and uncovered practitioners as explained below in the description of sensation itself.

source_sentence: 【疏】通生得加行有聞思修至非生得故者意說五識中得有加行善如聞思修三慧即加行善也問且如五識中有性得善可爾云何亦有加行善耶答聞思慧等五識當體即無若為彼第六識中聞思所引五識亦通有聞所成等問如何名所成能成耶答如聽經觀字而思法義是五識中聞思是所成此聞思眼耳等是意識中所成聞思之所引生意識聞思是能成如此所引眼耳等豈不是加行善耶有云聽經觀字而思法義者即是意識中所成聞思即此聞思是能成所引五識起名所成意說爾時五識名聞思所成者即得也二解前勝故五識有加行聞思善等生得劣善不說所成非生得故有意說加行善不是生得善也。
translation: [Commentary] The five consciousnesses are endowed with the virtues of applied practices, such as learning, contemplating, and cultivating the three kinds of wisdom, which are the virtues of applied practices.

source_sentence: 【疏】香積佛土鼻舌等識類此應知者此疏通外難外有難云眼耳二識可通聞思所成義如前說如何鼻舌等亦通聞思所成耶答鼻舌欲界色界雖無如香積佛土聞斯佛香即獲一切得藏三昧等既以香飯而作佛事也故言香積鼻舌類此應知亦有聞思也又菩薩後得智所引五識等淨土中聽法或說法或觀字或以香觸等而為佛事豈五識無三慧耶故經云諸所色為無非佛事問向其聞思義將明曉更成修慧唯理猶迷如何五識有修慧耶修慧依定發五識無定故答成所作智轉五識得成所作智當體即是修慧從定而得其義極成何勞虗稱作此難耶故為不可。
translation: [Commentary] The fragrant Buddha land, nose, tongue, and other consciousnesses should be understood because this commentary explains the external difficulties.

source_sentence: 【疏】所成之言義寬偏者意云聞思所引起五識識皆得所成之名故言五識有聞所成等。
translation: [Commentary] The term 'accomplished' has a broad meaning when it means that the five consciousnesses caused by hearing and thinking all get the name accomplished, so it's said that the five consciousnesses are accomplished by hearing and so forth.

source_sentence: 【疏】緣起經說至有覆性故者意云欲界意識有潤生愛等然五識中無若餘有覆無記性由意識有故亦引令五識中起也意引緣起經證五識有有覆無記性。
translation: [Commentary] The Sutra on Conditioned Arising explains that the five consciousnesses are covered and indeterminate because the consciousnesses are covered and indeterminate, but the other five consciousnesses are covered and indeterminate because the consciousnesses are.

source_sentence: 【疏】四無記中至相從四中變化所攝者意云然四無記五識得有三除變化變化唯自向意識中有所以五識無也然天眼耳可通有眼耳通即是眼耳相應慧也言相從四中變化所攝者謂變化與通相似通者無擁變化者於事不即隨意能成如幻術等故言相從是故通亦向變化中攝故五識但有威儀工巧異熟生等三無記也。
translation: [Commentary] Among the four indeterminate consciousnesses, those whose characteristics are included in the four mediums of change mean that although the four indeterminate consciousnesses can have three except for change, change is only inherent in consciousness, so the five consciousnesses don't have them.

source_sentence: 【疏】八十九雖言欲界有變化至自說是生得變化者此會難也外問曰欲界五識無變化者如何瑜伽說欲界而有變化耶今會云雖言欲界有變化不是五識中有也然此變化意識中法實上界繫今言欲界有者據相似者說如何相似答謂欲界意識亦能變作幻術等如種豆為丘馬等變樹草為軍旅攘等欲界意識中變化也以相似故故據意識中說欲界有變化又會云欲界有者謂上界意識若變金水邊等然似欲界中色香等以所變色等相似故言欲界有變化為為坐得上定意所變金等色見相皆是上界繫又會云言欲界有變化者有生得變化亦名報得變化不是意識中變化也問何名生得變化答如龍鬼神等皆有神變化之力謂不由修得但生便即得故名生得變化亦名報得者從前業感故如龍鬼神等皆能約授形質及雨食雷電等故名為變化故瑜伽自說欲界有生得變化。
translation: Although it's said that there's change in the desire realm until it's explained that there's birth and gain change, this would be a problem for outsiders who ask, "How can yoga say there's change in the desire realm when there's no change in the five consciousnesses?" It would be said that although it's said there's change in the desire realm, it's not something that exists in the five consciousnesses, but the reality in this changing consciousness is that the Dharma in the upper realm is bound to the consciousness.

source_sentence: 【疏】論文自說至又無威儀者即瑜伽自約小乘說也即今大乘五識得有威儀如前已說但約緣威儀名有威儀也若據小乘但說五識中有威儀類不得正威儀也謂小乘計云威儀心寬但餘三無記不攝者皆是威儀心也此心即是意識家威儀之類與大乘不同。
translation: That is, the yoga teaches itself in terms of the lesser vehicle that the five consciousnesses now have form and form as explained above, but it's called form and form in terms of conditional form and form. If the lesser vehicle only teaches that the five consciousnesses have form and form, then they can't have proper form and form, which is a lesser vehicle concept that the form and form mind is broad but the other three are not included in the indeterminate category of form and form.

source_sentence: 【疏】若不爾者至異熟生心寬者意識五識不緣威儀工巧等即但是異熟生心攝非是威儀心也以威儀心狹異熟生心寬故不同小乘。
translation: [Commentary] If that's not the case, then the five consciousnesses aren't conditioned by the manner and arts and crafts of the five consciousnesses, which are nothing but the mind of ripening sentient beings and not the mind of manner.

source_sentence: 【疏】又解第五相應門心王不名為所不屬心故者此重解第三繫屬於心一句。
translation: [Commentary] He also explains the fifth aspect of concomitance, "The mind king isn't called the mind that isn't attached to." This is a reinterpretation of the third phrase, "attached to the mind.

source_sentence: 【疏】由作意至功力勝者此顯作意能取總相亦取餘之心所各各別相故名功力勝也亦能令心心所取總別相故。
translation: [Commentary] From contemplation to superior strength shows that contemplation can take the general aspect and also take the distinctive aspects of the other mental factors, so it's called superior strength.

source_sentence: 【疏】此論以觸為初者此論中說遍行先列觸後說作意受想思等若據瑜伽先標作意後列觸受想等故有別也。
translation: [Commentary] This treatise uses contact as the first because it's said in this treatise that the omnipresent mental factors are listed first as contact and then as attention, feeling, perception, thought, and so forth.

source_sentence: 【疏】等損害俱相違者意說受能攝受損害等相也。
translation: [Commentary] This is because it's contradictory to both impairment and injury.

source_sentence: 【疏】思能了正因等者意顯思能了耶正等境因者邪正境為因也。

source_sentence: 【疏】中邊第一彌勒頌云等者意云此別辨中邊證別境五亦取總相兼取別相故說亦言問中邊唯說別境亦說餘心所答雖亦說餘心所今謂對前瑜伽說五遍引五別境文證緣總別相。

source_sentence: 【疏】二十六者謂根本有六隨煩惱二十故染有二十六也有疏云染有染三十二者謂根本有十隨煩惱有二十加邪欲邪勝解故成三十二也。
translation: [Commentary] Twenty-six means there are six basic, twenty follow-on afflictions, so there are twenty-six defilements. translation: [Commentary] To open and close five views and so forth means that this treatise and the Hundred Dharma Treatises that reveal the five aggregates say there are fifty-one mental factors as listed in the treatise itself, suffering, the fifty-third yoga, which relies on this treatise, fifty-one, and even more wrong desires and wrong overwhelming understandings.

source_sentence: 【疏】於四事中生五別境者如下說五別境於四境生謂於所樂決定串習觀察境中起緣別別境而得生也。
translation: [Commentary] The five distinct objects that arise in the midst of four things are explained below as the five distinct objects that arise in the midst of four objects, meaning that they arise in response to distinct objects in the context of the object of observation that's enjoyed by definite habituation.

source_sentence: 【疏】或俱或不俱別事生故意說欲界等五法於四境上或可得俱起或體事各別生如下五別境於四境生俱有俱不總別合有三十一句至文作法。
translation: [Commentary] Whether both or neither of them are produced by specific things, it's intentionally said that the desire realm and the other five dharmas may either arise together or have their own distinctive substance in the four objects, as follows: five distinctive objects are produced in the four objects, both with and without a general distinction, and there are thirty sentences up to the present time that create the Dharma.

source_sentence: 【疏】於善染等皆不定至等取餘二門者意說不定四於善染等皆不定也彼更有二門一謂非遍心起二謂非遍地有然此中善染等總有三門且第一簡唯善染以互相違今不定四皆通善染第二簡遍行遍行遍八識不定四通前六識不通七八至下第七自當分別第三簡別境別境遍三界九地皆有然不定四中前二唯欲後二至上界初禪有尋伺也今論言於善染等不定者即舉一門等二門也。
translation: [Commentary] Where good defilement and so forth are indeterminate, the meaning is that the indeterminate four are indeterminate in terms of good defilement and so forth. There are two further gates, one that refers to non-omnipresent mind and the other that refers to non-omnipresent ground.

source_sentence: 【疏】會文有二者初約根本隨惑俱是染故束六位為五第二約四一切辨其五位故瑜伽與此有別故以兩儀會也。
translation: First, it's about the fundamental derivative afflictions that are both defiled, so the six levels are grouped into five. Second, it's about the four omnipresent discriminations of the five levels, so the yoga is different from this, so it's explained in terms of the two rituals.

source_sentence: 【疏】言謂定俱生者即並頭生也又言俱者約此五心所常俱也時者望一切有心時言無始者約七八識說故無斷也。
translation: Also, when it says "together," it means the five mental factors are always together, and when it says "beginningless," it means the seven and eight consciousnesses are explained as being uninterrupted.

source_sentence: 【疏】此解為勝輕安不遍者意說一切地者約有尋伺等三地名一切地者即輕安不遍以欲界無輕安故。
translation: [Commentary] This explanation is superior. 'Lightness of mind doesn't pervade' means that someone who says 'all stages' refers to the three stages of discursive examination and so forth, which are called 'all stages' because there's no lightness of mind in the desire realm.

source_sentence: 【疏】若如初說從多分至而作論故者意云此舉輕安例煩惱亦許通餘地有若如初說者即第六卷解輕安中初師云輕安不得通欲界者有其二義第一約多分謂上八地有欲界一地無故從多分而論以欲界輕安調暢身心行相微劣所以言欲界無輕安據家亦有也第二義云要定加行方有輕安餘時即無意說欲界無輕安者據如前理說其實亦有也今言染四皆無者且從多分說其實亦通諸地即如無明貪等通三界九地八大隨惑亦通上地也且通俱者與染心相應故若爾如何言染四皆無耶答以煩惱中通者少不通者多以種類而言故說染四皆無據實亦通如下至本文中說。
translation: If it's as explained in the beginning, from the many parts to the making of the argument, it means that this is an example of light peace, and the afflictions may pass through to the remaining stages. If it's as explained in the beginning, that is, in the sixth scroll, the teacher explained that light peace doesn't pass through to the desire realm, there are two meanings.

source_sentence: 【疏】增上出生者意云以二義解根也一者增上二出生即由苦根為增上緣能生長苦法於其身心而逼迫樂根反此於其身心而生適悅故以二義解於根也問受與根何別答受者領納屬己根者但出生苦法故二者別又寬狹不同至下自解苦汎爾領納屬於己者即名為受能有出生增上之義方得根名受名為根必有領納自受但名為受不得名根未出生故所以受寬根狹。
translation: [Commentary] "Prominent birth" means that we understand the faculties in two ways: one is proliferating, and the other is birth because the painful faculties are the proliferating condition that produces painful dharmas in the body and mind and forces the pleasure faculties to act contrary to this and produce pleasure in the body and mind.

source_sentence: 【疏】領納境相具適悅身心者意云樂苦相對稱俱意說樂受及苦根俱有適迫身心等即苦樂相扶對名根。
translation: [Commentary] To apprehend the objects with pleasing body and mind means to say that pleasant feelings and painful roots both have pleasing bodies and minds, which are the names of the roots that are supported by painful and pleasant feelings.

source_sentence: 【疏】五識通依色心二依者此正釋二受別相身謂五根然眼等識相應三受實通依色心二依謂依識及根故而就不共別依說名身受五識即皆然若意識相應苦等三受唯依心故說名身受唯依意識故故說五識及意之言意在於相應受也。
translation: [Commentary] The five consciousnesses are generally based on the two bases of form and mind. This is a correct explanation of the two sensations that are experienced separately by the body, which are the five faculties, but the three sensations associated with the eye and other consciousnesses are really generally based on the two bases of form and mind, which are based on consciousness and the faculties.

source_sentence: 【疏】無漏第六意引生者由無學人第六識入觀時即無苦受若後出觀遇違境有若受如乞食不得被餓死等又無學聖人五根有漏初觀時五根且有不調暢性故有苦受言或唯後得智中方起等者意說從菩薩後得智大悲等力親所引生故亦通無漏如變身魚等但據菩薩二乘不然樂捨通無漏可然苦受相隱故逐難釋此即二二分別也謂身受心受為第一二又有漏無漏為第二二。
translation: [Commentary] The untainted sixth mind is induced by the sixth consciousness because when an unlearned person enters into contemplation, there's no painful feeling, and if they later exit from contemplation and encounter an object that's contrary to it, there's some feeling like begging for food and not being starved to death.

source_sentence: 【疏】十四一分見所斷一分修所斷者瑜伽文意計十四者謂七色根并命根并受五受根及意根也除信等五根三無漏根者然此八根如下自解故疏云謂除信等五及三無漏其十四一分見所斷者謂七色根及命根謂三惡趣業所惑或意識中分別煩惱所引生故後入見道時分別煩惱已斷更不能招當來黃門北鬱單半擇伽二形三途無想天及女人等故說此七色根及命根見所斷即因果果喪斷亦名不生斷畢竟更不受此身也一分修所斷者是有漏法故故修所斷其五受根及意根亦約分別煩惱無更不感故名見斷也是有漏故云一分修所斷言其餘可然者意說五受根并意根通見修二斷所以故云可然問信等五根是何斷答有二義一云是修所斷體通有漏者是修道故二云亦名緣縛斷謂煩惱緣信等起煩惱故斷能緣煩惱時信等得緣縛斷名也故瑜伽五十七云問二十二根中幾見所斷修所斷及非所斷等答十四一分見所斷一分修所斷十二一分修所斷一分非所斷謂即十四中六及餘六餘二非所斷乃至廣說論文今疏文依論廣說。
translation: [Commentary] Fourteen parts of what's stopped by seeing and one part of what's stopped by cultivating means the yoga text implies that the fourteen are the seven form faculties, life faculties, five sensation faculties, and mind faculties, except for the five faculties of faith and so forth and the three uncontaminated faculties.

source_sentence: 【疏】十二一分修所斷一分通不斷者意云以不斷對修所斷說十二一分非所斷攝者謂前見道斷中取五根及意根通無漏是不斷有漏者修所斷其憂苦二根亦非斷者苦根可爾如憂根名非斷者隨順趣向無漏非斷法名非所斷據實憂根不通無學後六者謂信等五根并未知當知根通無漏不斷有漏者修所斷也言應名無漏者意云憂苦二根應名無漏也何不說者以無漏不引論不說之但假名無漏非真無漏也。
translation: [Commentary] The twelve parts of what's cut by cultivation and the one part that's not cut by continuity means that the twelve parts of what's not cut by continuity are taken from the previous view that the five faculties and the thinking faculty are uncontaminated, that they are uncontaminated, contaminated, and that what's cut by cultivation, and that the two faculties of grief and pain are also not cut by suffering, so it's true that the grief faculty is called not cut by those who follow the path to the uncontaminated, uninterrupted dharmas called not cut by the grief faculty, and that the latter six are unknown, so it should be understood that the faculties are uncontaminated, uncontaminated, contaminated, and what's cut by cultivation.

source_sentence: 【疏】不可說六中是至五根亦應爾者意說前六但可取五受根意根不可說是命根無學人身中有苦許有者五根亦可爾何以故以無學身中有此根故故云五根亦應爾故不可言命根通非所斷但可取五受并意根也其已知根具知根唯非所斷。
translation: [Commentary] It can't be said that these six are the five sensory faculties that should also be present. This means that the first six can only be taken as the five sensory faculties, and the mind faculty can't be said to be the life faculty.

source_sentence: 【疏】苦根亦無學者無學人身中有苦根如前說無漏引故此即是兩三分別一云三斷二為三學言雖名同小者此三受名同小乘。
translation: [Commentary] The suffering faculty is also unlearned. There are suffering faculties in the unlearned person as explained above.

source_sentence: 【疏】論或總分四者意云亦不須分別云苦樂捨三別等莫作如是說但可總言受即是應通四種謂三性及無覆無記與六識相應即三性有是業感故名無覆無記。
translation: [Commentary] The treatise might summarize the four, meaning that it's not necessary to discriminate between the three distinctions of suffering, pleasure, equanimity, and so forth.

source_sentence: 【疏】五識皆通有此四性者有說三受各通此四性然樂捨二受皆具四性其義易解唯苦受可通三性善善不善無覆無記等唯有無記與苦受相應相貌難知故論偏釋如下自解問三受名通四性者如何苦受通於善性答勤修進道苦己身心故五識中得有苦受五識或與嗔等不善相應身心熱惱故有苦也然苦受是善惡業所感果即是無覆無記苦受通有覆無記者謂五識中有任運貪痴五識俱貪痴有二一者分別貪痴是見所斷一向不善二者俱生貪痴以任運起與五識俱是無記故得與五識中苦受相應又苦趣中第六識有痴慢愛身邊見等是無記故亦與意識中苦受相應意有苦根如下自說故瑜伽說一切煩惱皆於三受現行可得故知苦受同煩惱是有覆無記性也此則逐難釋苦根有覆無記意故次論云彼證意識中有苦受也。
translation: [Commentary] The five consciousnesses are all connected to these four natures. It's said that each of the three sensations is connected to these four natures, but the sensations of pleasure and equanimity both have these four natures, and their meanings are easy to understand.

source_sentence: 【疏】餘三通二性者即慢貪痴通不善及有覆無記性。
translation: [Commentary] The other three pass through two natures, namely, conceit, greed, delusion, unwholesomeness, and obscured indeterminacy.

source_sentence: 【疏】此五識中如何相狀者意說此貪等於五識中如何相狀如文自成。
translation: [Commentary] How do these five consciousnesses behave? This means to explain how greed and so forth behave in the five consciousnesses as the text itself shows.

source_sentence: 【疏】如率爾至無覆者此舉例也如五心中第四染淨意識若是有覆性遠引五識起有覆貪等。
translation: [Commentary] Thus, for example, if the fourth defiled and pure consciousness in the five minds is obscured, it will lead to the five consciousnesses that give rise to obscured greed and so forth.

source_sentence: 【疏】又非有覆意識不引五識生故者此通解意識引五識生也上來辨二四第一辨或總分四二辨容別四以下辨一五也。
translation: This is a general explanation of how consciousness leads to the arising of the five consciousnesses.

source_sentence: 【疏】飜前三相者意云由有三相故所以離於憂喜所受三相者如論云第一逼悅身心相各異故第二由無分別有分別故第三尤重輕微有差別故由有三相故苦樂受更離於憂苦受由捨受無前三相所以不分二也即捨受自有三義對前三相故不分二也一者非逼非悅相無異故二者無分別故三者平等轉故一一相配義。
translation: The three aspects of the sensation of equanimity are not two, because the sensation of equanimity has three meanings and the three aspects of the sensation of grief and joy are not two, because first, the sensation of neither pleasure nor pain is different, and second, because there's no discrimination, there's slight distinction, and third, because there are three aspects, the sensation of pleasure and pain is separated from the sensation of grief and pain.

source_sentence: 【疏】欲界初定隨應皆樂者意云欲界五識有樂受初靜慮有樂者眼耳身三識通初禪有故。
translation: [Commentary] "The desire realm's first concentration is enjoyable as it should be" means that the five consciousnesses of the desire realm are enjoyable, and the first concentration is enjoyable because the three consciousnesses of the eye and ear body are shared with the first dhyāna.

source_sentence: 【疏】大乘初二近分者意云初禪近分二禪近分唯有喜受若第三禪近分及根本有樂第四禪近分根本唯有捨也問何名近分答根本善已前加行方便即名近分分者因義故通四禪皆有近分。
translation: [Commentary] The first two near parts of the great vehicle mean that the near parts of the first dhyāna and the near parts of the second dhyāna are only joyful feelings, and if the near parts of the third dhyāna and the root are pleasant, the near parts of the fourth dhyāna and the root are only equanimous.

source_sentence: 【疏】以安靜適悅至在意名樂者以樂殊勝分別不及名無分別非總無分別亦如世人說言此味極美不得道意尤重者亦約殊勝說也。
translation: [Commentary] This is called bliss because the superiority of bliss is not discerned as nondiscrimination, not total nondiscrimination.

source_sentence: 【疏】離生喜樂者離性者離欲界生上界喜樂許初二近分有喜樂受也。
translation: [Commentary] 'Delighting in the absence of birth' means 'delighting in the absence of the desire realm and the upper realm,' and 'delighting in the first two parts of existence.'

source_sentence: 【疏】初門者即初二近分名初門對後根本故得初名若根本即是後門。
translation: [Commentary] The first aspect is that the first two proximate parts are called the first aspect, which is why it's called the first aspect when compared to the latter root, which is the latter aspect.

source_sentence: 【疏】初何故有喜之言等者總是或有義家難此論文令初二近分亦有樂也今正解者以下即是疏主自釋此論不說樂受之意。
translation: The following is the correct explanation of the commentator's own explanation of the meaning of this treatise's not talking about the feeling of joy.

source_sentence: 【疏】若言樂受至文言寬故者此文意說初二近分有樂受地獄中有憂受意說地獄雖有苦受不妨有憂初二近分雖言喜受不妨有樂以受言寬故若言苦根即唯一受者苦受不通憂也言苦受等此意說苦受中含憂受所言等者等樂受含喜受也。
translation: This text means that the first two near parts of hell have pleasant feelings, and in hell there are sad feelings. It means that although hell has painful feelings, it might as well have sadness, and although the first two near parts of hell say joyful feelings, it might as well have happiness.

source_sentence: 【疏】若言至何故不說者此師由難反成自義意識唯有憂受也。
translation: If he says, "Up to what point is it not explained," this teacher makes it difficult to refute the idea that consciousness has only grievous feelings.

source_sentence: 【疏】彼約五趣辨是異熟非異熟文者意說瑜伽論約五趣辨異熟生也所以不是辨真異熟文也。
translation: [Commentary] That discernment of the five destinies as ripening and not ripening is meant to say that the yoga treatise discerns ripening birth in terms of the five destinies, so it's not a discernment of true ripening.

source_sentence: 【疏】彼意唯苦何故言憂者意問曰若言地獄五識唯有苦受何故乃言有憂受耶問也言彼意唯苦者意說彼師意五識唯苦何故乃言有憂耶。
translation: [Commentary] He says his intention is only suffering, so why does he say grief? He means to ask, "If he says the five consciousnesses of hell are only painful feelings, why do they say there are grievous feelings?" He also says his intention is only suffering, which means to say that his teacher's intention is that the five consciousnesses are only painful, so why does he say there's grief?

source_sentence: 【疏】此師意說至約六識作論者即答問也我今依六識作論五識有苦相續意識有憂相續故云苦憂相續言地獄有八根者說五色根意根命根及憂根此師意說憂根為第八入定生中名捨入三不成中。
translation: [Commentary] This teacher's intention is to discuss the six consciousnesses, which is to answer the question. I'm now discussing the five consciousnesses based on the six consciousnesses, which have a continuum of suffering, and consciousness has a continuum of grief.

source_sentence: 【疏】彼唯說至不言傍生者意云瑜伽第五但約地獄鬼趣說有憂不言傍生今以第六十六有傍生文故今合引云一分鬼趣傍生亦爾。
translation: [Commentary] They only say that there's no saṃsāra, meaning that the fifth rank of the yoga only talks about hell's ghostly destinies as having sorrow and doesn't talk about saṃsāra.

source_sentence: 【疏】憂苦遍者謂地獄故者以此證知故地獄中意唯憂俱也意說地獄無客捨受故以憂根為第八此師意也。
translation: [Commentary] This is because this is the realization that the only thing in hell that's intended is grief. The intention is to say that hell is devoid of the sensation of guest equanimity, so this is the eighth aspect of the grief faculty.

source_sentence: 【疏】不善業輕至以少靜故者意云不善業輕所招執非極苦以有捨即少寂靜今既地獄受苦尤重不容有寂靜知無客捨受。
translation: [Commentary] Unwholesome activity is light, and it's because of a lack of quiescence that it means that the attachment associated with unwholesome activity is not extreme suffering because there's equanimity, which is a lack of quiescence.

source_sentence: 【疏】憂即分別加行分別故者意說捺落迦中無分別煩惱言憂分別者但是於境分明知有苦具而生憂慼是憂分別之行相也名加行分別。
translation: [Commentary] Grief is discrimination, and it's because of applied discrimination. This means that there are no discriminating afflictions in naraka, but he discerns the objects and knows there's suffering and becomes grieved.

source_sentence: 【疏】既言三等者意云既云任運生一切煩惱皆於三受現行可得明知苦受與身見相應有覆無記性然憂根性通善惡故知地獄而無憂根。
translation: [Commentary] Since they say three and so forth, it means that since it's said that all the afflictions that arise naturally are present in the three sensations, it's clear that painful sensations are associated with body views that are obscured and indeterminate, but the grief root's nature is shared by good and bad.

source_sentence: 【疏】一根善不善以三性為境者即憂根也既言善不善明知憂根不通有覆無記又緣於三性起即是二十二根中憂根此總是引瑜伽論文說地獄及餘識中二十二根有成不成文也。
translation: [Commentary] A good and unwholesome person who takes the three natures as objects is also the grief root. Since it's called good and unwholesome, it's clear that the grief root doesn't understand obscuration and indeterminacy and arises in reference to the three natures, which are the grief root of the twenty-two faculties. This is a general reference to the text of the Yogâcārabhūmi-śāstra teaching that the twenty-two faculties in hell and the other consciousnesses are formed and not formed.

source_sentence: 【疏】除三者即除三無漏根所餘或成不成者約信等五根及男女根等。
translation: [Commentary] Except for the three, that is, except for the three uncontaminated faculties, the remaining five faculties such as faith and the male and female faculties may become unproved.

source_sentence: 【疏】三約現行至無涅槃者釋三無漏根地獄之中三無漏根現行必定不成種子約有性無性辨成不成。
translation: [Commentary] These three explanations of present functioning to the absence of nirvāṇa explain that the three uncontaminated faculties in hell and the three uncontaminated faculties in present functioning must not be formed, and these seeds are identified as formed or unformed based on their nature and non-nature.

source_sentence: 【疏】餘三現行至成就者此樂喜憂三若一向苦處即種成現不成若雜受處後三種現亦成就對前三無根故喜樂等得後三之名。
translation: [Commentary] The other three manifest activities that lead to accomplishment are those of joy, happiness, and sorrow. If these three have always been in the place of suffering, then the seeds become manifest and aren't formed.

source_sentence: 【疏】現種俱成八者至有一二形別故者此即釋彼論文也言五根意命根為七者問何故不言第八根耶答為後師將主捨為第八憂根入三不成就中苦根入不定中若前師以憂根為第八客捨入三不現行中苦根亦入不定中今不言第八者為兩家諍未定所以不言言樂喜定不成現者憂根既是所諍故亦不言但言樂喜言其信等五現種有成不成者有斷善不斷善有差別故言男女一二形別故者為地獄惡業招容有一形或有二形又由惡業招容無形故現亦有成不成故成不成言通信等及男女兩處文也。
translation: This is an explanation of the thesis that the five faculties, the mind and life faculties are seven. Why isn't the eighth faculty mentioned? The answer is that the latter teacher will give the master the eighth faculty, and the grievance faculty will enter the three unfulfilled forms, while the painful faculty will enter the uncertain one.

source_sentence: 【疏】苦根入現不定等者問何故不定耶答如生死之位由惡業故逼切身心命終等時方有苦根又如住極悶絕位六識不行如何有苦故是不定或極善業所招生死之位苦根六識亦無。
translation: [Commentary] "The entry and manifestation of the faculty of suffering is uncertain," he asks, "Why is it uncertain?" Ans. If the stage of birth and death is forced by bad karma to cut off the body, mind, and life, then the faculty of suffering only exists at the end of life, and if the stage of extreme stifling is abiding, how can the six consciousnesses not function?

source_sentence: 【疏】不爾餘三即無法故者若取以客捨為現不爾者即瑜伽言三現不成者而無法也言無法者但闕不成三名無非三現無也。
translation: [Commentary] If it's not the case that the other three are unavailable, then it's not the case that the yoga says the three manifestations are unavailable and there's no possibility that those who say there's no dharma only lack unavailability and the three are not the three manifestations are absent.

source_sentence: 【疏】若言喜樂更取一形者是前師難也謂言後師三不成中取一形為第三也以第二師許地獄無形故為此難也難意云若唯取一形為第三者何故不取男女二形耶若後師言無二形者難云豈鬼畜等無男女二形耶答若云鬼畜許有地獄無者難云何故地獄中無男女二形耶此皆前師假設為難。
translation: [Commentary] If someone says joy and pleasure and then takes one form, this is a difficulty for the former teacher, which is to say that the latter teacher takes one form as the third of the three unproved forms because the second teacher admits that hell has no form.

source_sentence: 【疏】雖無睡等者釋解伏難云地獄既無極重睡眠如何說言彼無六識答雖無睡眠而有生及死并悶絕等三位故無六識也六識既無意根寧有。
translation: [Commentary] Although there's no drowsiness, how does the explanation of the difficulty of resolving the problem say that there's no sixth consciousness in hell since there's no deep sleep? Answer: Although there's no drowsiness, there's birth, death, stifling, and the other three; therefore, there are no six consciousnesses.

source_sentence: 【疏】等活地獄至何處有者意云若前師言死生二位無客識無憂根者男女等活地獄非但有生死二位亦極悶絕時豈悶絕時有意識耶。
translation: [Commentary] Where does the hell of equal life exist? This means that if the previous teacher said that the two stages of birth and death have no guest consciousnesses and no sense faculty, then the hell of equal life for men and women doesn't only have the two stages of birth and death but also extreme swoon.

source_sentence: 【疏】又若爾者至五識相續故者若以身識相續有苦根者彼苦處中意識憂根何須間斷更無別所以故不可以意識間斷五識相續故長讀文。
translation: [Commentary] Also, if this is the case up to the point where the five consciousnesses continue, then if there's a painful faculty that's continuous with the body consciousness, how would the grief faculty of the thinking consciousness in that place of suffering need to be interrupted and there's nothing else? Therefore, it's not possible to interrupt the five consciousnesses that are continuous with consciousness, so read the text at length.

source_sentence: 【疏】又意無捨受非易起受者意云明真捨受非是易脫起受意既有間斷明此俱捨受是易脫起第八捨受非易脫起受故云非易起受易者易脫也。
translation: [Commentary] Also, the intention is that there's no equanimous feeling that's not easily arisen. The intention is that it's clear that true equanimous feeling isn't easily arisen, and the intention is that there's an interruption that shows that this club equanimous feeling is easily arisen, and the eighth equanimous feeling isn't easily arisen, so it's called not easily arisen, but easily arisen.

source_sentence: 【疏】意中苦受至間斷者意識中苦受約客受說亦有間斷然五識中苦不斷以身識等相續故。
translation: [Commentary] Suffering feelings in the mind up to the point of interruption means that suffering feelings in consciousness are also interrupted according to the objective feelings, but suffering in the five consciousnesses doesn't stop because of continuity in the body consciousness and so forth.

source_sentence: 【疏】據起意已後必相續者前師悶絕等位意識憂根並無若後起了還復意中憂根相續故瑜伽說餘三現行定不成就文亦無妨也。
translation: According to the former teacher, the grievous faculty of consciousness at the level of stifling has no grievous faculties that are later produced and continue in the grievous faculties of consciousness.

source_sentence: 【疏】嗔於未位與捨俱故者以地獄苦逼多嗔捨俱受地獄苦末容有捨也捨亦有慼行故故捨通三性但非苦亦而得捨名不妨客捨通三性也。
translation: Because anger is forced by hell's suffering and anger and equanimity, there's equanimity at the end of hell's suffering and equanimity at the end of suffering.

source_sentence: 【疏】彼無異熟樂名純苦處故者意云說餘二趣至名純苦者據無異熟樂故得純苦名。
translation: [Commentary] He says the absence of ripening pleasure is called the pure abode of suffering because he means to say that the other two destinies are called pure suffering because there's no ripening pleasure.

source_sentence: 【疏】又彼無異熟有等流樂至一切皆無者意說地獄純苦處異熟樂等流樂並無故云此名純苦一切皆無。
translation: [Commentary] Also, there's no ripening, there's equanimous bliss, and they're all nonexistent. This means that the pure painful places of hell, ripening bliss, and equanimous bliss are both nonexistent, so it's called pure suffering and they're all nonexistent.

source_sentence: 【疏】對法第七等說至少分故者意說意地嗔與憂受相應或意戚名憂者從多分說不妨亦有苦受及餘煩惱也即人天全起憂鬼畜趣少分有故云多分其實意地亦有苦也即會前師意地尤重戚受尚名為憂況餘輕者文。
translation: [Commentary] This is because the seventh and so forth in the explanation of the principle of equality means that it's said that anger in the mind ground is associated with feelings of grief, or that grief is called grief because it's said from many perspectives that there are also painful feelings and other afflictions, namely, grief in humans and gods, grief in ghosts and animals, and so many perspectives.

source_sentence: 【疏】若細分別至故不相違者餘聖教說意識與憂相應者有二意一者約麤相說二約隨轉門若據子細分別意得與苦受相應故故疏云一切見道惑通在意地故瑜伽五十九云不通一切識身者意地一切根相應又如疏云一切俱生通三三受故故五十九云若任運生一切煩惱此於三受現行可得此約從細與前多分麤相不相違也。
translation: The remaining noble teachings say that consciousness is associated with grief in two ways: first, it's explained in terms of the coarse aspect, and second, it's explained in terms of the aspect of continuity. If according to the subtle discrimination of the subordinate mind, it's possible to associate it with painful feelings, so the commentary says that all the afflictions of the path of seeing pass through to the mind ground.

source_sentence: 【疏】非實是食者非是滋養順益之食但可得名不損斯兩箇文段意與憂俱者皆是隨小乘說謂小乘許若在五識憂在意識故今依大業意中有苦受也有云此第一解依隨順門說。
translation: [Commentary] This is not really food, but it's not food that nourishes and benefits, but it's food that gets its name and doesn't harm the meaning of these two passages, which is to follow the lesser vehicle teaching that the lesser vehicle accepts the five consciousnesses as grievous and mindful.

source_sentence: 【疏】或依上座部主異熟無間者彼部計由異熟異苦憂相續而生今瑜伽云語有情類異熟無間有異熟生苦憂相續者亦隨彼宗說五識苦相續意識憂相續也其實意識中有苦也。
translation: [Commentary] Some people rely on the Theravādin school, which states that [the continuity of] suffering and grief arises from [the continuity of] retribution. Now, the yoga says that there are varieties of sentient beings who are retributive and uninterrupted, and there's the continuity of suffering and grief from retribution.

source_sentence: 【疏】即是無性第二上座九心隨彼說者彼部說九心之中有分心是異熟心故由異熟心有苦憂相續也。
translation: [Commentary] That's the second highest seat of the nonnature of the nine minds according to that teaching.

source_sentence: 【疏】或依彌沙塞部至異熟意識生故者此部說異熟意識有憂根相續所以大論亦隨小乘說意有憂其實有苦受今疏文在下方說者不次也此說為定依前大眾上座二部一處會也。
translation: [Commentary] Perhaps it's based on the Mahīśāsaka school that the second seat of the matured mind arises because this school says that the matured mind has the faculty of grief, so the Mahāyāna also follows the lesser vehicle in saying that the mind has grief and really has painful feelings.

source_sentence: 【疏】大論第五至亦隨轉門者瑜伽言尋伺憂俱者隨經部宗且說有憂理實兼苦以下所會意皆同也。
translation: [Commentary] The fifth point of the Mahāyāna also follows the approach of those in the Yoga School who say that the investigation, examination, and grievance are the same as those in the Sutra School and say that there's grief, and the principle is really both painful and the following are the same.

source_sentence: 【疏】問彼六十六說至唯地獄等耳也者意問曰且如瑜伽六十六說約五趣辨其憂苦何故餘趣不約隨轉理門語唯地獄意中苦受隨他小乘喚為憂耶舉論答云地獄意中實是苦根而非是憂然此苦根是餘雜受憂之類故所以論說意地苦受為憂問何須作此會耶答以前師說意中有憂受故引瑜伽證地獄中有憂受所以會云此隨小乘說非大乘正義以小乘許地獄中意唯有憂故論又彼苦根等者第二會論或彼苦根等者第三會也故此苦根通損身心不同於憂不可為例也。
translation: [Commentary] He asked, "Did the yoga say in the sixty-six verses that only hell and so forth are grievous and painful?" He asked, "Furthermore, as the yoga said in the sixty-six verses that the grievances and pains of the five destinies are identified, why aren't the other destinies discussed in the gate of principle of retrieval, and only the painful feelings in the mind of hell are called grievances by other lesser vehicles?" He answered, "The mind of hell is really suffering and not grieving, but this suffering faculty is a type of grieving that's mixed with other feelings.

source_sentence: 【疏】離生喜樂者離欲界生初禪等也問如坐近分定若命終者生在何處答既未得根本定還生欲界若坐得上根本定方得離生喜樂近分不爾。
translation: [Commentary] 'Delighting in escaping birth' means escaping the desire realm and being born in the first dhyāna, etc. He asks, 'Where will he be born if he sits in the near part of concentration and his life ends?' Answer: Since he hasn't yet attained fundamental concentration, he'll be born in the desire realm, and if he sits in the higher fundamental concentration, then he'll be able to delight in escaping birth.

source_sentence: 【疏】豈為有樂言等者意云豈謂有離生喜樂言即含近分而有樂耶。
translation: [Commentary] Does it mean that there's joyful speech and so forth? Does it mean that there's joyful speech that's free from birth, which includes the near part and yet there's joy?

source_sentence: 【疏】義說為二即喜名樂者既義說者喜應是假有若是實有何不名喜若定喜時而亦名樂故者不然望義有別且如無漏智等亦名無為望有為樂所為即非有為若望四相所為即非無為豈即無漏假耶此亦應然仍同一種義別說也然此善樂但由定力滋益身心令適悅生非是緣境生喜樂等。
translation: Since it's explained that there are two meanings, namely, joy and happiness, and since it's explained that joy should be nominally existent and truly existent, why wouldn't it be called joy if it's also called happiness when one is concentrated on joy? Otherwise, they look at the meaning differently, such as when uncontaminated cognition and so forth is also called being without being.

source_sentence: 【疏】亦餘時意慼受憂故者意云非但餘時處意地慼受名苦即純苦處苦處意地慼受亦名苦根。
translation: [Commentary] It's because of the grief experienced by the mind at other times that it means that not only is the grief experienced by the mind at other times and places called suffering, but also the grief experienced by the mind at the place of pure suffering and the place of suffering is called the root of suffering.

source_sentence: 【疏】令不壞相續名食生其捨受者無順適悅名食故不生喜樂也。
translation: [Commentary] It's called food that causes continuity of indestructibility, and those who experience equanimity don't experience food that's pleasing and disagreeable; therefore, joy and happiness don't arise.

source_sentence: 【疏】定中通喜樂等者意云定中無違境不約憂苦以明欲界容三受俱也。
translation: He means that there's no disagreement in concentration that doesn't involve grief and suffering in order to clarify that the desire realm accommodates all three sensations.

translation: [Commentary] The five kinds that are fully produced means that there are five kinds of desire and so forth that are combined on the four, and each one is separately produced and has five sentences that are combined into thirty one sentences in a general and specific way.

source_sentence: 【疏】乃至等流亦有此事者意云等流心等中亦無欲等五也且如等流通多種即三性心中皆有等流其無記等流即無欲不善等流亦起染心不作意緣亦無欲等又生得善心亦無欲等故云此類非一問五心中既有決定何故無欲解耶答雖有決定但不希望既無欲也又非印持故無勝解故知欲等非必定與心心所俱。
translation: [Commentary] Even when there's continuity of continuity of sameness, there are five continuities of continuity of sameness, namely, the absence of desire, the absence of good continuity, the absence of defiled states of mind, the absence of mental intent, the absence of desire, and so forth.

source_sentence: 【疏】皆意引生者意說五識相應念緣現在時皆由意識引發也。

source_sentence: 【疏】一引等故至名為等引者意說等在於心之內即此等由定所引得名為等引據義合云引等。

source_sentence: 【疏】等所引故至等能引故者意說等在於加行位今此定數由加行位中等而所引也名等引即等是能引定數是所引。
translation: [Commentary] Equally induced therefore to equally induced therefore means that equality is found in the stage of applied practices, and this concentration is induced by the intermediate stage of applied practices and is called equally induced, meaning that equality is induced by the concentration and the concentration is induced by it.

source_sentence: 【疏】此在定位定數從前加行得名者此定中心等從加行得名然等與定亦相似。
translation: [Commentary] This is a concentration at the level of concentration that gets its name from the previous applied practices.

source_sentence: 【疏】平等持心等者等取心所也。
translation: [Commentary] Equanimous-holding mind and so forth is equally grasped as a mental factor.

source_sentence: 【疏】此與等引大義皆少同者二俱唯定非散俱通上二界等名同而通有心無心故別等至通無心通凡聖得若等引定唯有心不通無心亦通凡得故二定亦別然二俱是根本定問二何別答等引定非於定心名通果無記引神通變大地等若已於定即無此類等至不然通無心故。
translation: [Commentary] Both this and equipoise are less alike in their greater meaning. Both are only concentrations, not distracting, and both pass through the upper two realms and so forth with the same name and pass through mind and no mind.

source_sentence: 【疏】例餘三識亦然者眼耳二識既有慧例餘三識亦有慧也或是無記至彼類故者意云三識有慧所由也或是無記者說慧是無記也如五識緣境有微劣簡釋等慧非善慧故名無記如緣威儀等慧能彫刻功工等總名無記。
translation: [Commentary] Exemplifying the other three consciousnesses as well, the eye and ear consciousnesses have wisdom, so the other three consciousnesses also have wisdom.

source_sentence: 【疏】或生得慧者意說三識中慧或是生得善慧生便即得是俱生故。
translation: [Commentary] Perhaps wisdom that arises is obtained because it means that wisdom in the three consciousnesses is either produced or attained, or good wisdom is produced and then attained.

source_sentence: 【疏】或加行慧聞思修所成者若直言聞慧等五識即無若因聞等所成五識得有即由相應意識引五識方有也是彼類者意說三識中聞思修所成慧即是彼天眼耳二通之類也以天眼耳通亦修成故有云生得慧是彼加行聞思修所成慧之類也前解正。
translation: [Commentary] Maybe the five consciousnesses such as the wisdom of applied practices and that formed by hearing, contemplating, and cultivating are nonexistent, but if the five consciousnesses formed by hearing and so forth come into existence, then the five consciousnesses will only come into existence because of the associated consciousness. This is their type, meaning that the wisdom formed by hearing, contemplating, and cultivating of the three consciousnesses is their type of the two powers of the divine eye and ear.

source_sentence: 【疏】佛地論說至妙觀察智者此引佛地論之文云除漏盡通一个餘通並是第六中妙觀察智此總引文以下自會云以眼耳俱意至觀察智攝者此正論文也以眼耳俱時意識多相續故不間斷故所以說意識中有天眼耳二通亦但說慧俱時有者則多是妙觀察智攝不是眼耳二識而無通也謂二識多間斷故且隱二識不論但言意識有二通等。

source_sentence: 【疏】此就他家設說五識無欲等故者意云以前師不許五識有欲等但就他家說前許意地有苦故欲等得與苦受相應。
translation: [Commentary] This refers to other teachings that say the five consciousnesses are devoid of desire and so forth, meaning that previous masters didn't allow the five consciousnesses to have desire and so forth but referred to other teachings that previously allowed the mind ground to have suffering so that desire and so forth could be associated with painful feelings.

source_sentence: 【疏】非以煩惱等中至與相應者意云不與者煩惱中有欣慼行有貪欣行及善中有生得加行善心及緣三世並緣真如等心差別故即不與欲可相應也雖有如是差不妨亦與欲等相應也讀者當悟意說句見欲等緣所樂境等則謂將不慼等行相相應雖有如是差別不妨於此境中起希望等故云須即相應也論六始信等。
